Name: Strawberry Leaf Scorch
Description: Strawberry leaf scorch is a fungal disease that can affect strawberry plants. It is caused by the fungus Diplocarpon earliana and is characterized by the appearance of reddish-brown spots on the leaves, which can eventually lead to the death of the entire leaf.

Treatments.Plant resistant varieties:: Some varieties of squash are more resistant to powdery mildew than others.

Treatments.Water properly: Water your strawberry plants at the base rather than from overhead, and avoid getting the leaves wet if possible. This can help prevent the fungus from spreading.

Treatments.Practice good sanitation: Keep the area around your strawberry plants clean and free of debris. This can help reduce the chances of the fungus surviving over the winter and infecting new growth the following spring.

Treatments.Remove infected plant material: As soon as you notice symptoms of strawberry leaf scorch, remove and destroy any infected leaves. This will help prevent the disease from spreading to other parts of the plant.

Products.Azoxystrobin or Pyraclostrobin: These are systemic fungicides that can be used as a preventive measure or as a curative treatment when the disease is still in the early stages.

Products.Sulfur-based fungicides: Sulfur-based fungicides are another option for organic growers. They work by inhibiting the growth of fungal spores and can be used as a preventive measure or as a curative treatment.

Products.Biological control agents: Biological control agents such as Bacillus subtilis or Trichoderma harzianum can be used to reduce the severity of the disease. They work by colonizing the plant and outcompeting the pathogen for resources.
